content.title: REDUNDANCY CONSULTATION LETTER
content.body:
[EMPLOYER_NAME]
[EMPLOYER_ADDRESS]

[DATE]

Private and Confidential

[EMPLOYEE_NAME]
[EMPLOYEE_ADDRESS]

Dear [EMPLOYEE_NAME],

Re: Proposed Redundancy - Consultation

I am writing to inform you that your role of [JOB_TITLE] is at risk of redundancy.

Business Situation:
[BUSINESS_CONTEXT]

Proposed Changes:
[PROPOSED_CHANGES]

Your Role:
Your position is at risk because [REASON_FOR_RISK].

Consultation Process:
This is the start of a consultation process. We are committed to meaningful consultation and no final decisions have been made. The consultation will involve:

- Individual consultation meeting(s) with you
- Opportunity to make representations and suggest alternatives  
- Consideration of alternative employment
- [IF 20+ REDUNDANCIES: Collective consultation with employee representatives]

Consultation Meeting:
I would like to invite you to a consultation meeting on [MEETING_DATE] at [MEETING_TIME] at [MEETING_LOCATION]. The purpose is to:

- Explain the business situation in detail
- Discuss the selection process and criteria
- Explore alternatives to redundancy
- Discuss possible alternative roles
- Answer your questions

You have the right to be accompanied by a work colleague or trade union representative.

Please confirm your attendance by [CONFIRM_DATE]. If you cannot attend, please let me know and we will arrange an alternative time.

In the meantime, if you have any questions, please contact [CONTACT_PERSON].

Yours sincerely,

[SIGNATORY_NAME]
[SIGNATORY_TITLE]

compliance_checklist: Clear that role is 'at risk' not confirmed redundant
Meaningful consultation period (minimum 30 days for 20-99, 45 days for 100+)
HR1 form submitted to DECC if 20+ redundancies
